content.question: On February 13, 2016, following the death of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell issued a statement that the Supreme Court vacancy should be left to the next president of the United States, who would be elected that November. Nonetheless, President Obama nominated circuit judge Merrick Garland to fill the vacancy. The Senate judiciary committee never held a hearing nor was a vote scheduled on the nomination. The scenario demonstrates that

choices.label: the Senate prefers to pick members of the Supreme Court
there are very few qualified individuals who can serve as Supreme Court justices
because the judicial branch is elected, the Supreme Court must be responsive to public opinion
because federal judges are lifetime appointments, Senate confirmation can often be challenging

content.answer: because federal judges are lifetime appointments, Senate confirmation can often be challenging
